cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine: Integrative Medicine v. Functional Medicine Institute of Functional Medicine clarified their stance on COVID-19 (https://www.ifm.org/news-insights/covid-19-vaccines-statement/) which starts with: "In the interest of the public good, IFM supports the use of authorized COVID-19 vaccines for whom it is clinically indicated." It is a muted support of vaccine - perhaps advocating for individual's clinical indication. This is contrasted by University of Arizona Center for Integrative Medicine's stance on COVID-19 (https://integrativemedicine.arizona.edu/covid_19.html) which states: "We are so grateful that effective vaccines are becoming available. The physicians at our Center, including Dr Weil, have now gotten vaccinated. Integrative medicine supports vaccination as an important pillar of our public health approach to COVID-19."
